summary: The Chicago City Council's ordinance establishes the Parking Alternative Response Pilot Program in the 8th and 19th Police Districts. Rapid Response Parking Enforcement Aides, managed by the Superintendent of the Chicago Police Department, the Commissioner of the Department of Finance, the Commissioner of the Office of Emergency Management and Communications, and the Traffic Compliance Officer, will handle parking enforcement, freeing police officers for other duties. The program aims to reduce response times, serve as a model for alternative programs, and increase parking violation enforcement.
